brothers.description: Felix is getting increasingly physical with Milo, in a good way. He gives him kisses and hugs, and he is always careful to use a gentle touch.
brothers.title: Brothers

brothers2.description: Felix even tries a little tumbling around, but Milo just wiggles away.
brothers2.title: Brothers 2

cheese.description: The flavor of the week is grated cheese. Milo loves it because it is easy to pick up, and Felix loves it because he can pretend he is an elephant eating hay with his trunk.
cheese.title: Cheese

dressing.description:
Felix is (finally!) showing an interest in dressing himself. He is wearing sweat pants almost every day lately, because they are easier to take on and off (a must for going to the potty unassisted).

Note the snazzy UFO underwear. Milo is envious.
dressing.title: Dressing

monsters1.description: Felix likes monsters, dinosaurs and aliens. And for every thing he likes, he wants a version built out of legos. We oblige.
monsters1.title: Monsters 1

monsters2.description:
Though the TRUE lego monster is little Milo. He mercilessly pounces on every creation, oblivious to the wails of "nooooooo, Milo!" from Felix.

Quality lego hour happens in the evening with Dean, while Lucie bathes and nurses Milo to sleep.
monsters2.title: Monsters 2

mouthing1.description: Milo is developing a taste for Legos.
mouthing1.title: Mouthing 1

mouthing2.description:
Milo has a troubling habit of shoving objects as far into his mouth as possible and keeping them there. He's already given us a few scares.

See that big jingle bell? Its twin is in Milo's mouth, and will be for the next 5 minutes. We never had this problem with Felix.
mouthing2.title: Mouthing 2

picnic.description: Picnic at Codornices Park. We now have a hook-on chair to keep our wiggle worm contained.
picnic.title: Picnic

wharf1.description: What's everybody at Fisherman's Wharf (except Lucie) looking at?
wharf1.title: Wharf 1

wharf2.description: Sea lions snuggling!  Felix wanted to play snuggling sea lions for days afterward, which we were happy to oblige.
wharf2.title: Wharf 2

yard1.description: The landscaping is progressing. The workers have finished excavating the path were the bricks will go.
yard1.title: Yard 1

yard2.description: The path goes from the front to the back of the house.  There will be a little patio in the front, to catch the afternoon sun.
yard2.title: Yard 2

yard3.description: The irrigation system's been installed so we can make as much mud as we want.
yard3.title: Yard 3

yogamoms1.description:
Lucie and Milo still hang out with the yogamoms, nap permitting. About half the babies are crawling. We discuss teething pains, feeding tips and sleeping woes.

Left to right: Jaime, Elliot, Argil with mom Sara, Ariel with mom Celia, and Milo the blur.
yogamoms1.title: Yogamoms 1

yogamoms2.description: What are Elliot and Milo staring at? Amy, Elliot's mom, rattling a tupperwear of Cheerios. What a tease!
yogamoms2.title: Yogamoms 2

zzz.description: A backseat full of sleeping little boys... so so cute!
zzz.title: Zzz

description:
Felix thoughts have turned towards the existential lately. He's grappling with the idea that he wasn't always here. He asks us about our childhood. He asks "When I no exist, you missed me? You thought about me?". He is also curious about death. He knows one of his fish died and isn't likely to come back. We explained that once you are dead, you can't talk or walk or do anything. His response: "If you no can walk, how about a special chair with wheels?".

And he asks "Why dinosaurs no exist no more?". Because the weather got cold and dinosaurs don't have coats or houses. Follow up: "Do elephants still exist?" We show him pictures of himself looking at elephants.

Felixism: "I use my magic nation" (imagination).

Milo has been saying "ma ma ma" for a while, but now it really sounds like "Maman", and it really feels like he means Lucie. He also says "pa pa pa", but it's still a little unclear whether he means Dean.
title: April 10
